name: Nurse Graves
descriptions: Nurse Graves is a ghoul who helps Doctor Barrows in Underworld in Fallout 3.

Young by ghoul standards, Doctor Barrows' assistant Nurse Graves is knowledgeable and keen. She helps in Barrows' experiments to diagnose and treat the various brand-new ailments that ghouls are always complaining about. Happy with her lot in life, she spends her time cutting up corpses, inspecting brain tissue samples, and poking feral ghouls with a variety of (mainly sharp) implements.

Unlike other ghouls in the Fallout universe, she sympathizes with humans as much as ghouls (stating they were all the same once) while most other ghouls and humans are on non-friendly terms. She will mention that Doctor Barrows performed experiments on Reilly while she was in her coma
Her name "Graves" refers to burial graves, a reference to the Underworld's theme of death.

topics.topic: DLC03WQSickDoctorTopicFull house today, Doc. What's wrong with everybody?
topics.topic_text: What's wrong with everybody? I didn't think Ghouls got sick.
topics.response_text: Neither did I. Doctor Barrows is working on it, but it doesn't look good. They're getting worse by the day.
Welcome to the Chop Shop. I'm Nurse Graves, Doctor Barrows' assistant.

topics.topic: MS14CrowleyWhat can you tell me about Mister Crowley?
topics.topic_text: Do you talk to Crowley much? Can you tell me anything about him?
topics.response_text: He's not my type. Doc Barrows is friendly with him though. Why don't you ask him.

topics.topic_text: I'm injured. Anything you can do for me?
topics.response_text: Certainly, we can help you. Please speak to Doctor Barrows.

topics.topic_text: Amazing! Do you think it will really work?
topics.response_text: Well, we're trying not to get too excited. Not only because we want to keep it quiet, but also because the experiments look so promising.
Not impressed, huh? Oh well. I didn't expect a human to understand the gravity of this experiment anyway.

topics.topic_text: A Ghoul that wants to be human? That's a good one!
topics.response_text: Well, I've never been so insulted! I expected a little more from you, but I see you humans are almost all alike!

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Reilly?
topics.response_text: Poor girl. I didn't think she'd make it through the first night she was brought in here.

topics.topic_text: Why does Doctor Barrows care so much about humans, anyway?
topics.response_text: The doctor is convinced that the key to curing our... appearance is locked within the human body.

topics.topic_text: You seem to be taking very good care of her.
topics.response_text: Well, she's very important to Doctor Barrows and she's my patient.

topics.topic_text: He's experimenting on her? That's twisted!
topics.response_text: First and foremost on Doctor Barrow's mind is her health and well-being. I can assure you of that.

topics.topic_text: Has he met with any success?
topics.response_text: So far, none of his conclusions are finalized, but the tests he's running are coming up quite positive!

topics.topic_text: It's nice that you care so much.
topics.response_text: I don't share the philosophy that Ghouls and humans are different. We were all the same once.

topics.topic_text: Hmph. I thought Ghouls hated humans.
topics.response_text: Humans have too many misconceptions. Some of us don't get along with humans, but the majority of us are learning to live with our differences.
Well, some of the Ghouls in Underworld object to what the Doctor is doing.

topics.topic_text: What exactly is the doctor trying to do? You can tell me.
topics.response_text: He's trying to come up with a cure. A way to stop the human to Ghoul transition. Perhaps even one day to reverse it!
